meanings.definition: The quality or state of being enforceable.
meanings.sent1: The enforceability of the contract ensured that both parties would fulfill their obligations.
meanings.sent2: The judge questioned the enforceability of the new law in court.
meanings.sent3: The enforceability of the bedtime rule led to a hilarious pillow fight.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had an enforceability that could move mountains.
meanings.sent5: The enforceability of safety regulations is crucial to prevent accidents.

meanings.definition: The ability to be enforced or carried out.
meanings.sent1: The enforceability of the parking regulations was evident when the tickets were issued.
meanings.sent2: Without enforceability, rules would be mere suggestions.
meanings.sent3: The enforceability of the no-smoking policy was put to the test when someone lit a cigar.
meanings.sent4: His leadership had an enforceability that inspired his team to achieve great things.
meanings.sent5: The enforceability of the plan depended on everyone following their assigned tasks.
